en: Turn off the alarm.

My alarm clock didn't work. That's why I was late.

The alarm clock is ten minutes fast.

When my alarm clock goes off, I always stop it in my sleep.

en: I overslept because my alarm didn't go off.

At present, he is in Canada.
Don't ignore your subordinates.

ko: 나 안 보는 사이에 일어난 일이야.

en: Close your eyes.

en: Lie on the bench for a while with your eyes closed.

en: Don't shut your eyes.

Close your eyes, please.
Close your eyes, and count to ten.

en: Don't keep your eyes on the ground; look at me.

en: Dry your eyes.

Wake up!
Wake up.

en: When she awoke, the family was there.

Open your eyes, please.

The eyes are as eloquent as the tongue.
The eye is sensitive to light.
I'm awake.
I'm up.
The eye is bigger than the belly.
It is cruel to mock a blind man.

en: The blind young man has got over his handicap.

en: The blind young man has overcome his handicap.

en: The blind man felt his way toward the exit.

en: There was nothing but water as far as the eye could reach.

en: I thought my eyes were playing tricks on me.

Tightly-knit carpets are generally more valuable.

en: There was not a man without tears in his eyes.

en: I met a keen-eyed guy.

en: Tears came to my eyes.

en: I got a bug in my eye and I can't get it out.

en: Out of sight, out of mind.

en: Their eyes met.

en: My eyes are brimming with tears.

en: My eyes are bloodshot.

en: I awoke to find a burglar in my room.

en: To be awake is to be alive.

en: It was almost noon when I woke up.

en: He cannot speak well that cannot hold his tongue.

en: Shut your big mouth.

en: Silence is an admission of guilt.

en: Being silent is regarded in effect as approval.

en: Hold your tongue, or you'll be punished.

en: Hold your tongue!

en: I see a house among the trees.

en: Wood is a disappearing resource in much of Africa, and these stoves burn far less wood than the stoves currently in much use.

en: Making a model plane is interesting.

en: You'll get into trouble.

en: For the gate is wide and the way is easy, that leads to destruction.

en: I am to talk over the matter with him tomorrow.

en: I'm going shopping tomorrow.

I'll answer you tomorrow.
The other day he said to me, "I will lend you this book tomorrow."
ko: 며칠 전에 그 사람이 나한테 "이 책 내일 빌려줄게"라고 했어.

en: I'll have this radio fixed tomorrow.
I'd better see you about this tomorrow.
ko: 이 일 때문에 내일 너 좀 봐야겠다.

en: He said that he would come back here tomorrow.
ko: 그가 내일 여기 다시 오겠다고 했어.

en: I promise that I'll be here tomorrow.
Come here tomorrow without fail.
Don't forget to come here at seven tomorrow.
ko: 내일 7시에 여기 오는 거 잊지 마.

en: I will come tomorrow without fail.
The seasonal rain front is moving in tomorrow.
Everybody is in a good mood looking forward to the five-day holiday that starts tomorrow.
ko: 내일부터 시작되는 5일간의 휴가 때문에 다들 기분이 좋아 보여.

en: For two weeks from tomorrow, please.
I'll pay you a visit at your house tomorrow.
I'll call at your house tomorrow.
I'll visit your home tomorrow.
I'll come to visit you at your house tomorrow.
Do you mind if I call on you tomorrow?
May I see you tomorrow?
See you tomorrow.
I'd like to see you tomorrow.
I will have finished reading this novel by the time you come tomorrow.
ko: 내일 네가 올 때쯤이면 이 소설 다 읽었을 거야.

en: If you are free tomorrow, I can show you around Kyoto.
ko: 내일 시간 되면 교토 구경시켜 줄게.

en: I am seeing my uncle tomorrow.
My uncle is coming to see us tomorrow.
Could you come and see me tomorrow?
ko: 내일 나 보러 와 줄 수 있어?

en: We are going to make a test of the engine tomorrow.
It may possibly be fine tomorrow.
I will call on you tomorrow.
I'll visit you tomorrow.
May I call you tomorrow?
I'll get hold of you tomorrow and set up a time.
Can you wake me up at 7:00 tomorrow?
I will meet you at three o'clock tomorrow.
There's going to be a three-mile race tomorrow.
Will you let me have a holiday tomorrow?
Please let me take a day off tomorrow.
Can I see you at ten tomorrow?
Tomorrow ... tomorrow seemed such a long, long way off.
ko: 내일... 내일은 정말 아득하게 멀게만 느껴졌어.

en: I'm going to give a birthday party for my friend tomorrow.
ko: 내일 친구 생일 파티 해 줄 거야.

en: Remember to see him tomorrow.
ko: 내일 꼭 그 사람 만나는 거 잊지 마.

en: Mind you call me up tomorrow.
Call her tomorrow.
He's not going to visit you tomorrow.
ko: 걔 내일 너 안 찾아갈 거야.

en: Since I will see him tomorrow, I can give him a message if you want.
ko: 나 내일 그 사람 만날 거니까, 원하면 말 전해 줄게.

en: What do you say to doing the sights of Tokyo tomorrow?
We will go on a picnic if it is fine tomorrow.
We’ll go on a picnic tomorrow if the weather allows.
We’ll go on a picnic tomorrow if the weather’s good.
I'm taking tomorrow morning off from work.
You're pretty calm cool and collected for somebody who has a major presentation tomorrow.
ko: 내일 중요한 발표 있는 사람 치고는 꽤 차분하네.

en: It will snow tomorrow.
It will be snow tomorrow.
There will be snow tomorrow.
I hope the weather will be fine tomorrow.
I was wondering if you'd like to join me for dinner tomorrow.
I have an appointment with my uncle tomorrow.
Can I rely on you to be here on time tomorrow?
I was wondering if you were free tomorrow.
I will take my mother out in my new car tomorrow.
ko: 내일 새 차로 엄마 모시고 나갈 거예요.

en: Tomorrow, I'm going to take my mother out in the new car.
ko: 내일 새 차로 엄마 모시고 나갈 거예요.

en: Will you look after my dog tomorrow?
ko: 내일 우리 강아지 좀 봐줄 수 있어요?

en: Would you please look after my dog tomorrow?
Tomorrow our professor is going back to England.
You shall have my answer tomorrow.
There will be a lunar eclipse tomorrow.
They will have a moon-viewing party tomorrow.
I'll call you up tomorrow.
A friend's coming over tomorrow.
I will meet you at the station tomorrow.
What do you say to going swimming tomorrow?
I hope it rains tomorrow.
Can I borrow your Ford for tomorrow?
ko: 내일 포드 차 좀 빌릴 수 있을까요?

en: Please remind me to mail the report tomorrow.
ko: 내일 리포트 보내라고 말 좀 해주세요.

en: I will visit you tomorrow without fail.
Do you mind my visiting you tomorrow?
You mustn't forget to come and see me tomorrow morning.
ko: 내일 아침에 꼭 보러 와야 돼요.

en: I'll come without fail tomorrow morning.
Do we have to get up early tomorrow morning?
May I call on you at your house tomorrow morning?
I'll see you at nine tomorrow morning.
They will have gone to school by eight tomorrow morning.
Will you pick me up at seven tomorrow morning?
ko: 내일 아침 7시에 데리러 올 수 있어요?

en: Call me up at seven in the morning.
I want to check out at 6 tomorrow morning.
We will have to set out early tomorrow morning.
Meiji was beaten by Keio by a score of three to five.
Akiko has some friends in France.
Akiko has several friends in France.
ko: 아키코는 프랑스에 친구가 몇 명 있어요.

en: Akiko has an aunt whose name is Hana.
He took to Akiko from the moment he met her.
I'd like you to itemize the charges.
I plan to watch a game at the baseball field the day after tomorrow.
ko: 모레 야구장에 경기 보러 갈 거예요.

en: If it rains the day after tomorrow I'll be inside.
ko: 모레 비 오면 실내에 있을 거예요.

en: If it rains the day after tomorrow, I'll stay at home.
ko: 모레 비 오면 집에 있을 거예요.

en: I must get my work done by the day after tomorrow.
I must get this work done by the day after tomorrow.
I'll come back the evening after next.
Let's have a tea party the day after tomorrow.
The day after tomorrow I will urge my mother to leave an allowance of 10000 yen at my disposal.
ko: 모레 엄마한테 만 엔만 달라고 졸라볼 거예요.

en: Come and see me the day after tomorrow.
She will start for Kyoto the day after tomorrow.
He hasn't said so explicitly, but he's let it be understood that I was lying.
ko: 딱 부러지게 말하진 않았지만, 제가 거짓말했다는 식으로 눈치를 주더라고요.

en: The first point that requires clarification is that the design was purely experimental.
ko: 먼저 짚고 넘어가야 할 점은, 그 디자인이 순전히 실험적이었다는 거예요.

en: Four points need to be made.
ko: 네 가지 정도 짚어볼 점이 있어요.

en: Clarity comes first.
She waved her hand to me, smiling brightly.
ko: 그분은 환하게 웃으면서 저한테 손을 흔들어 줬어요.

en: It began to be light, and things were becoming visible by degrees.
ko: 날이 밝아오면서 주위가 조금씩 보이기 시작했어요.

en: It's getting light. Morning is coming.
Let's put up the tent while it is still light.
ko: 아직 밝을 때 얼른 텐트 쳐요.

en: Let's pitch the tent while it's still light.
The bright colors arrested our eyes.
The children's laughs spread throughout the forest.
Feel light at heart; feel happy.
Clearly, she knows a lot about biotechnology.
ko: 보아하니 생명공학에 대해서 아주 잘 아시는 모양이에요.

en: She was clearly satisfied with the results.
It is clear that he knows the answer.
ko: 그 사람이 답을 알고 있는 게 확실해요.

en: It was apparent that he did not understand what I had said.
ko: 제 말을 못 알아듣는 게 빤히 보였어요.

en: Obviously he is wrong.
Evidently, he's made a mistake.
ko: 보아하니 그가 실수를 한 것 같네요.

en: Obviously, he's not that kind of person.
Obviously, he is to blame.
Someone is obviously telling a lie.
Obviously, someone is lying.
Clearly you are mistaken.
Clearly, this is the most important point.
ko: 이게 가장 중요한 포인트라는 건 확실해요.

en: Clearly, the rumor is not true.
ko: 그 소문은 사실이 아닌 게 분명해요.

en: Clearly, the rumor isn't true.
Obviously, they are jealous of his wealth and status.
ko: 그 사람의 재산이랑 지위를 시기하는 게 뻔해요.

en: Obviously, he is lying.
It gets extremely cold toward dawn.
It was cold at dawn, so I put on another blanket.
ko: 새벽에 추워서 이불 하나 더 덮고 잤어요.

en: Happy New Year!
I can't reach the transom.
I can't reach the skylight.
Put out the light.
Turn off the light.
Put out the light and go to bed.
Don't turn off the light.
Will you turn on the light?
The light shone like so many stars.
Don't sleep with the light left on.
The light went out by itself.
The light went out and we were left in the dark.
Poor light hindered my reading.
The light came on suddenly.
You left your lights on.
They can't have gone out because the light's on.
ko: 불이 켜져 있는 걸 보니 나갔을 리가 없어요.

en: He must be at home as the light in on.
ko: 불 켜진 거 보니까 집에 있는 게 분명해요.

en: The light is on.
Where there is life, there is hope.
Where there's life, there's hope.
Life is dear to everybody.
Life's seed is laid.
While there is life, there is hope.
While there's life, there's hope.
It's not the sort of illness that puts your life at risk.
Do as I told you to do.
I felt as if my life had been shortened.
I found this at the risk of my life.
As long as there is life, there is hope.
He got angry because his honor was at stake.
ko: 명예가 걸린 일이라 그가 화를 냈어요.

en: Please add my name to the list.
Write your name in full.
When you have written your name, write the date.
Please have a seat and wait until your name is called.
ko: 앉아서 이름이 불릴 때까지 기다려 주세요.

en: Did you hear your name called?
My heart beat when I heard my name called.
Those students whose names have been called will begin their exams.
ko: 이름이 불린 학생들은 시험을 시작할 거예요.

en: Stand up when your name is called.
Please tell me your name.
I quite forget your name.
A writer, whose name I have forgotten, wrote this novel.
ko: 이름은 잊어버렸는데 어떤 작가가 이 소설을 썼어요.

en: My name is Ichiro Tanaka.
I don't know her name, but I do know her by sight.
Although the names are similar, they are far from being the same.
What is his name?
What's its name?
Her name was Linda, and she was a year younger than Tony.
ko: 그녀의 이름은 린다였고, 토니보다 한 살 어렸어요.

en: I'm not sure of the name, but the extension is 211.
All the names are listed in alphabetical order.
There has been a little confusion of names.
Name and address, please.
I only know him by name.
Don't make fun of him because he cannot write his name.
ko: 이름을 못 쓴다고 그를 놀리지 마세요.

en: When you have written your name, please write the date.
ko: 이름을 다 쓰면 날짜를 써 주세요.

en: I heard my name called.
Answer to your name when it is called.
It is hard to maintain one's reputation.
Some people go after fame.
Don't chase after fame.
Fame is not always an accompaniment of success.
ko: 명성이 꼭 성공을 따라오는 건 아니에요.

en: It is very hard to live up to your reputation.
Despite all his fame, he is not happy.
It is wrong to aim at fame only.
ko: 명성만을 목표로 삼는 건 잘못된 거예요.

en: I'm seeing all the sights.
There were too many sights to see in a day or two.
ko: 하루 이틀 만에 다 보기에는 볼거리가 너무 많았어요.

en: Sometimes a verb is derived from a noun and sometimes it is the other way around.
ko: 때로는 명사에서 동사가 나오기도 하고 그 반대인 경우도 있어요.

en: Nagoya is between Tokyo and Osaka.
Nagoya is a city which is famous for its castle.
Nagoya is a city famous for its castle.
Nagoya is a city that's famous for its castle.
Nagoya is to the east of Kyoto.
I usually have to change my clothes two or three times a day during the hot summer in Nagoya.
ko: 나고야의 더운 여름엔 보통 하루에 옷을 두세 번씩 갈아입어야 해요.

en: What's the stop after Nagoya?
In Nagoya summers a fan is essential to help stay cool.
ko: 나고야 여름엔 더위를 식히려면 선풍기가 필수예요.

en: Can you stand the summer heat in Nagoya?
ko: 나고야의 여름 더위, 버틸 수 있겠어요?

en: Nagoya lies between Tokyo and Osaka.
Speaking of Nagoya, have you ever been to Seto?
ko: 나고야 얘기가 나와서 말인데, 세토에 가본 적 있어요?

en: Finding one's way around Nagoya is very simple. All you do is look at the signs.
ko: 나고야에서 길 찾는 건 아주 간단해요. 표지판만 보면 되거든요.

en: I took over the wheel at Nagoya.
A good idea occurred to me.
A good idea suddenly struck her.
A great idea presented itself in my mind.
ko: 머릿속에 아주 좋은 아이디어가 하나 생겼어요.

en: Profit is better than fame.
A good idea occurred to me last night.
Everybody who is anybody was present at the reception.
ko: 그 리셉션에는 내로라하는 사람들은 다 왔더라고요.

en: The nether gate was opened.
The daughters recuperated from the shock of the death of their father.
It isn't that both daughters want to study abroad.
ko: 두 딸이 다 유학을 가고 싶어 하는 건 아니에요.

en: I entered my daughter in a girl's school.
Can my daughter go to school?
My daughter will come of age next year.
My daughter is the apple of my eye.
ko: 우리 딸은 눈에 넣어도 안 아플 정도예요.

en: My daughter was premature.
The girl begged her mother to accompany her.
ko: 그 여자아이는 엄마한테 같이 가달라고 졸랐어요.

en: My daughter weighed eight pounds at birth.
My daughter has braces.
My daughter held on to my coat sleeve and would not let me go.
ko: 우리 딸이 제 코트 소매를 붙잡고 안 놓아주더라고요.

en: Our daughter is none the better because we've been nursing.
ko: 계속 간호하고 있는데도 우리 딸 상태가 전혀 나아지질 않네요.

en: My daughter has grown into a dress my wife used to wear.
ko: 우리 딸이 다 커서 아내가 입던 원피스가 딱 맞아요.

en: My daughter will come of age this year.
My daughter prefers science to languages or art.
ko: 우리 딸은 어학이나 예술보다 과학을 더 좋아해요.

en: My daughter is barely fifteen.
ko: 우리 딸은 이제 겨우 열다섯 살이에요.

en: Her father is liberal with money.
ko: 그녀의 아버지는 돈 쓰는 데 후한 편이에요.

en: I'd like to have her teeth straightened.
My daughter is cutting her permanent teeth.
The girls' chatter was endless.
Wondering if my daughter had arrived safely I tried to call her but couldn't get through.
ko: 딸이 잘 도착했나 싶어 전화해 봤는데 연결이 안 됐어요.

en: We have decided to leave our daughter to herself after she left school.
ko: 딸이 졸업한 뒤로는 그냥 스스로 알아서 하게 두기로 했어요.

en: The return of his daughter brightened his life.
ko: 딸이 돌아오자 그의 삶도 다시 밝아졌어요.

en: I think my daughter's coming down with something.
ko: 우리 딸이 몸이 좀 안 좋은 것 같아요.

en: Our daughter burned her finger with a match.
ko: 우리 딸이 성냥을 켜다가 손가락을 데었어요.

en: My daughter came to see me from time to time.
He can't help his daughter being so foolish.
ko: 딸이 저렇게 어리석게 구는 건 그도 어쩔 수 없나 봐요.

en: He had one daughter.
The land could just be discerned through the mist.
Fog was a familiar sight in London.
ko: 런던에서 안개는 흔히 볼 수 있는 풍경이었어요.

en: The fog won't clear until there's a wind to blow it away.
ko: 바람이 불어서 안개를 날려 보내기 전까지는 안 걷힐 거예요.

en: A boat suddenly appeared out of the mist.
ko: 안개 속에서 갑자기 배 한 척이 나타났어요.

en: We could see nothing but fog.
Railroad service was suspended because of the fog.
The mountain was blurred by fog.
Due to the fog, traffic is temporarily suspended.
The fog prevented the planes from taking off.
The valley was hidden from view in the mist.
Fog has limited visibility to 100 meters.
The girl disappeared in the misty forest.
ko: 그 소녀는 안개 낀 숲속으로 사라졌어요.

en: The fog closed in.
A curtain of mist blocked our view.
The fog is getting thicker.
It was foggy, so it was hard to make out the figures of people walking.
ko: 안개가 심해서 걷는 사람들의 형체를 알아보기 힘들었어요.

en: The fog was thickening quickly.
The fog has lifted.
The fog is growing thicker.
The mist was so dense that I could not see even an inch ahead.
ko: 안개가 너무 짙어서 한 치 앞도 안 보였어요.

en: I hope the fog will go away soon.
Conflicting reports prompted the director to reconsider her position.
ko: 상충되는 보고들 때문에 이사님은 자신의 입장을 재검토하게 됐어요.

en: Is it free?
They're giving away samples free.
It's for free.
It's free.
This is free.
That's free.
You may get it free of charge.
I don't wanna press you.
You must think it's impossible, but could you at least give it a try?
ko: 안 된다고 생각하시겠지만, 시도라도 한 번 해봐 주실래요?

en: Don't exert yourself.
Where might is master, justice is servant.
ko: 힘이 지배하는 곳에서는 정의가 뒷전이기 마련이에요.

en: You're bound to feel that way at first, I guess.
It's reasonable that you feel that way at first.
I'm not asking for the moon.
It's not an impossible request.
I don't think she could spare the time because she is always busy with her work.
ko: 그분은 항상 일로 바빠서 시간을 내기 힘들 것 같아요.

en: Don't work too hard!
Try to avoid overdoing it.
Don't overexert yourself.
You should take it easy.
The strain is beginning to tell on him.
ko: 과로한 기색이 그 사람에게 나타나기 시작했어요.

en: Might makes right.
The reckless men froze to death during their expedition to the Antarctic.
ko: 그 무모한 사람들은 남극 탐험 중에 동사했어요.

en: The two men were arrested for reckless driving.
ko: 그 두 사람은 난폭 운전으로 체포됐어요.

en: Making love to an expressionless woman is like sipping soup without any seasoning.
ko: 무표정한 여자와 사랑을 나누는 건 간이 안 된 국을 먹는 것과 같아요.

en: He is riding for a fall.
ko: 그 사람은 스스로 화를 자초하고 있어요.

en: Plain white paper will do.
I shouldn't have overdone it.
You should not be absent without notice.
Ignorance is bliss.
You must not park your car there without permission.
It was a wild goose chase.
It's high time you stopped wasting your money.
ko: 이제 돈 낭비는 그만할 때도 됐잖아요.

en: So use it wisely and don't waste it.
ko: 그러니까 아껴서 잘 쓰고 낭비하지 마요.

en: Don't waste your breath.
